'''Blissey''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ハピナス''' ''Happinas'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Chansey}} when [[level]]ed up with high [[friendship]]. It is the final form of {{p|Happiny}}.

==Biology==
Blissey has a large, ovoid body with a pink upper body and white lower body. It has hair-like curls on either side of its head. White, wing-like tufts grow from its hips and shoulders, creating the impression of a dress. Its stubby arms and feet are pink and lack any digits. A small, pink pouch on its belly holds a single egg, which brings feelings of happiness and makes a person pleasant and caring if ingested. Blissey can use its fluffy fur to sense sadness, and will rush to anyone feeling sad or ill and attempt to nurse him or her back to health. Its evolutionary line is the [[signature move|only one capable]] of learning {{m|Soft-Boiled}}. Blissey is a female-only species with no male counterpart. An {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Urban Pokémon|urban Pokémon}}, it is rarely seen in the wild.

==In the anime==
[[File:Nurse Joy Blissey.png|thumb|left|220px|Blissey in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Nurse Joy's Blissey]]====
Blissey debuted in ''[[EP129|Ignorance is Blissey]]'', where she emerged as a friend of [[Jessie]]'s from their time at the [[Pokémon Nurse School]]. Additionally, Nurse Joys in the [[Alola]] [[region]] are assisted by Blissey.
<!--
====Other====
-->
===Minor appearances===
A Blissey was seen at the [[Pokémon Swap Meet]] in ''[[EP146|Tricks of the Trade]]''.

A Blissey briefly appeared in ''[[EP171|Power Play!]]''.

A Blissey appeared in ''[[SM004|First Catch in Alola, Ketchum-Style!]]'', during a fantasy.

==In the manga==
[[File:Emerald Blissey Adventures.png|150px|thumb|Blissey in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Blissey debuted in ''[[PS091|Murkrow Row]]'' where she was seen as one of the Pokémon in [[Joey]]'s bag after {{adv|Gold}} helped him get it back.

A Blissey captured by {{adv|Crystal}} and lent to {{adv|Emerald}} for his [[Battle Pike|Pike]] challenge appeared in ''[[PS309|Moving Past Milotic]]''. With her high Special Defense and suitable nature, she served the boy well and, although she was eventually defeated, she had used {{m|Softboiled}} to revitalize Emerald's {{p|Rapidash}}.

[[Cheryl]] has a Blissey which was used against [[Mira]] and her {{p|Alakazam}} in ''[[PS417|Leaping Past Lopunny]]''.

In ''[[PS446|Weavile Wobbles But It Won't Fall Down]]'', a Trainer at the {{safari|Johto}} owns one.

==Trivia==
* Blissey's {{stat|HP}} is the [[List of Pokémon by base stats|highest base stat]] of any Pokémon.
** At 255, this is the maximum possible value for a base stat.
* With a base experience yield of 608, Blissey has the largest experience yield of any Pokémon.
** Blissey is also the only Pokémon whose base experience yield is greater than its base stat total.
* Blissey has the highest base {{stat|Special Defense}} stat of any {{type|Normal}} Pokémon.
* Blissey shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Togetic}}. They are both known as the Happiness Pokémon.

===Origin===
Blissey appears to be based on a nurse, specifically sharing some physical similarities with [[Nurse Joy]] from the {{pkmn|anime}} in both color and hair. Its tendency to carry eggs in a pouch is much like a {{wp|monotreme}} or {{wp|marsupial}}, but may also simply be based on a general concept of females and motherhood.

====Name origin====
Blissey is a combination of ''bliss'' (happiness) and the suffix ''-sey'' from ''{{p|Chansey}}'', its pre-evolution.

Happinas may be a corruption of ''happiness'', or a combination of ''happiness'' and ''nurse''. It may also involve 茄子 ''nasu'' ({{wp|eggplant}}), referring to the egg theme of this evolutionary line.
